item.title: OnePlus 13R launching in India on January 7: Price, design, specs and everything expected | Mint - Mint
item.description:
OnePlus 13R launching in India on January 7: Price, design, specs and everything expected

Publication Date: N/A Source: Live Mint

OnePlus is set to unveil its flagship smartphone, the OnePlus 13R, at an event on January 7, alongside the OnePlus 13 and OnePlus Watch 3. This device is projected to be a key competitor in the premium mid-range segment for 2025.

OnePlus 13R expected specifications:

  • 6.78-inch 8T LTPO AMOLED display with 4,500 nits peak brightness.
  • Powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 processor with Adreno 750 GPU.
  • Support for up to 16GB of LPDDR5X RAM and 1TB of UFS 4.0 storage.
  • Triple camera setup with 50MP primary sensor, likely including a telephoto lens.
  • 16MP front camera.
  • IP65 rating for dust and splash resistance.
  • Expected to run OxygenOS 15 on Android 15.

In China, pricing starts at 3399 yuan for 12GB RAM/256GB storage model. Possible Indian price around ₹40,000 is still to be confirmed at the launch.

item.title: Israel eliminates Hamas commander Abd al-Hadi Sabah linked to Kibbutz Nir Oz attack on October 7 - The Times of India
item.description:
Israel eliminates Hamas commander Abd al-Hadi Sabah linked to Kibbutz Nir Oz attack on October 7

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of Israel

In a significant military operation, Israel eliminated Hamas commander Abd al-Hadi Sabah, who was connected to the October 7 attacks on Kibbutz Nir Oz. This action underscores Israel's ongoing efforts to counter Hamas activities in the region.

  • Abd al-Hadi Sabah was a key figure in planning attacks against Israel.
  • The operation aimed to dismantle Hamas leadership in response to recent escalations.
  • Israeli defense forces are intensifying their operations in Gaza.
"The elimination of Sabah is a crucial step in our efforts to ensure the safety and security of our citizens." - Israeli Defense Official

This operation is part of a broader strategy by Israel to neutralize threats from Hamas and stabilize the region following heightened tensions.

item.title: Retirement Hint? Australia Great Highlights Rohit Sharma's "Unusual" Act, Says This On Virat Kohli - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Retirement Hint? Australia Great Highlights Rohit Sharma's 'Unusual' Act, Says This On Virat Kohli

Publication Date: December 31, 2024

Source: NDTV

The discussions surrounding India captain Rohit Sharma's potential retirement from Test cricket have intensified following a significant loss to Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

  • Rohit Sharma's performance and emotional state during the recent Test match raise questions about his future in the longest format of the game.
  • Justin Langer observed Rohit displaying unusual emotions on the field, suggesting that he may be considering retirement.
  • Langer noted the stress Rohit faces as captain when team performance falters and personal runs are lacking.
  • Contrastingly, Langer believes Virat Kohli still has years of top-level cricket ahead of him.
  • Both Langer and Ravi Shastri agree that this could be the end of Rohit's Test career but see a different trajectory for Kohli.
"Rohit Sharma looks very tired to me. I saw him quite emotional on the field yesterday. That's unusual for us to see Rohit like that." - Justin Langer

In conclusion, the ongoing discussions indicate a pivotal moment for Rohit Sharma as he contemplates his career while Virat Kohli seems to have more time left in international cricket.

item.title: Vinesh Phogat stripped of Olympic medal; Khelif gender row; BCCI vs PCB: 10 controversies of world sports in 2024 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Top 10 Controversies in World Sports of 2024

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The year 2024 has seen significant controversies across various sports, igniting debates and discussions globally. The incidents highlighted not only challenges in sports integrity but also the socio-political implications within the sporting arena.

  • 1. Vinesh Phogat's Olympics Disqualification: The Indian wrestler was disqualified from the Paris 2024 Olympics just hours before her final due to being overweight.
  • 2. Imane Khelif Gender Row: Algerian boxer Khelif faced gender eligibility controversies after her gold medal win amidst heated discussions over gender policies.
  • 3. PCB vs BCCI for Champions Trophy 2025: Clash over hosting rights due to political tensions raised questions about cricket governance.
  • 4. Sanjiv Goenka and KL Rahul Spat in IPL 2024: A public dispute raised debates about management practices in cricket franchises.
  • 5. Magnus Carlsen Disqualified from World Rapid and Blitz: The chess legend faced dress code violations during a crucial tournament.
  • 6. Real Madrid Boycotts Ballon d'Or: The club protested against perceived biases in award voting.
  • 7. Jannik Sinner Doping Violations: The tennis star faced doping allegations amid a complex investigation process.
  • 8. Igor Stimac and AIFF tussle: The coach of India's men’s football team had a dramatic exit leading to contractual disputes.
  • 9. Protests Against FIFA for 2034 World Cup Allocation: FIFA's decision attracted backlash due to Saudi Arabia's human rights record.
  • 10. Formula 1 Budget Cap Violations: Multiple teams faced serious penalties for breaching financial regulations.
“The integrity of sports is under threat as controversies continue to surface.”

2024 has proven to be a pivotal year, with these controversies reflecting the growing complexities and challenges that are reshaping the landscape of sports while prompting necessary dialogues about governance, fairness, and integrity within the field.

item.title: 7 colourful images of star clusters captured by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope - India.com
item.description:
7 Colourful Images of Star Clusters Captured by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope

Published on: January 1, 2025 Source: India.com

This article showcases vibrant images of star clusters taken by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope, revealing the beauty and complexity of these distant celestial formations.

  • The Hubble Space Telescope captures stunning images of various star clusters.
  • Notable clusters featured include NGC 2210, Terzan 12, NGC 6652, NGC 6355, NGC 376, NGC 6440, and NGC 1850.
  • These clusters are located in the Milky Way and the Large Magellanic Cloud.
"These stars comprise the open cluster NGC 376, which has a total mass only about 3,400 times that of the Sun."

Overall, the piece highlights the remarkable capabilities of the Hubble Space Telescope in capturing the vivid and dynamic nature of star clusters.

item.title: 'He is not a nasty person': Ex-Australia captain defends Virat Kohli's character despite 'shoulder bump' - The Times of India
item.description:
Ex-Australia Captain Defends Virat Kohli After MCG Incident

Publication Date: Date not specified Source: Times of India

The Boxing Day Test at Melbourne saw a notable incident between Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas, which sparked discussions about Kohli's character.

  • Virat Kohli had a shoulder bump incident with Australian debutant Sam Konstas during the match.
  • Michael Clarke suggested that Kohli's frustration was due to a perceived lack of respect towards Bumrah.
  • Despite the incident, Clarke defended Kohli, stating he is not a nasty person and likely spoke with Konstas after the game.
  • Konstas scored 60 runs in the match, contributing to Australia's 184-run victory.
  • Nitish Kumar Reddy also made headlines for scoring his maiden Test century during the same match.
"Virat is a great guy. He is not a nasty person. I think it was Virat sticking up for his team." - Michael Clarke

The incident at the MCG highlights the competitive nature of cricket while underscoring the importance of sportsmanship.

item.title: Today's Quordle Answers and Hints for January 01, 2025 - Sportskeeda
item.description:
Today's Quordle Answers and Hints for January 01, 2025

Date: January 01, 2025

Source: Sportskeeda

Quordle Answers (January 01, 2025): Struggling to solve today's Quordle? No worries. We have today's Quordle hints and answers for you to solve it on your own!

If you're a fan of word puzzles, you probably already know that Quordle is a more challenging version of Wordle. Instead of guessing just one word, Quordle requires you to guess four five-letter words simultaneously within nine attempts.

Key Points:

  • Today's Quordle answers: CLING, SUITE, WORRY, TONIC.
  • Quordle Chill answers: SLATE, USAGE, COMIC, WHINE.
  • Quordle Extreme answers: BRUTE, PHONY, TIMID, TWIRL.
  • Quordle Sequence answers: STALK, CHAIN, ADULT, BOARD.
WARNING: Spoilers ahead! Only read on if you want to know today's Quordle answers.

And that's a wrap! That's all the Quordle answers for the day.

item.title: Pushpa 2 Hindi Box Office Day 27 (Early Trends): Allu Arjun Brings Top 10 Highest Grossing Last Day Of The Year, Pushes Bajirao Mastani Out! - Koimoi
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Hindi Box Office Day 27: Allu Arjun Sets New Record

Publication Date: January 1, 2024 | Source: Koimoi

Allu Arjun delivered a successful last day of the year at the box office, bringing a record total for Pushpa 2 Hindi as the year concludes. The film stands at an estimated total of 782 crore after 27 days and is expected to cross the 800 crore mark soon.

Key Points:

  • On December 31, Pushpa 2 earned approximately 6.25 – 6.5 crore, a 13% increase from the previous day.
  • It achieves the 10th biggest last day of the year box office collection for Hindi films, surpassing Bajirao Mastani.
  • The total estimated collection is 782 crore against a budget of 200 crore, resulting in a 291% profit margin.

Notable Quotes:

"Box office numbers are based on estimates and various sources. Numbers have not been independently verified by Koimoi."

In conclusion, Pushpa 2 has not only dominated the box office but also set a new benchmark for last day collections within the Hindi film industry.

item.title: Military court upholds plea deal, spares 9/11 suspects the death penalty - The Times of India
item.description:
Military Court Upholds Plea Deal, Spares 9/11 Suspects the Death Penalty

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: [Insert Source Here]

The military court has approved a plea deal that exempts several suspects involved in the 9/11 attacks from facing the death penalty, stirring controversy and debate.

  • The court's decision is a significant legal ruling regarding the treatment of terror suspects.
  • Victims' families express mixed reactions, with some feeling justice is not served.
  • The plea deal includes commitments regarding the treatment and future legal processes for the suspects.
  • This case highlights the ongoing complexities surrounding military justice and terrorism-related cases.
“This decision reflects a complex interplay of legal principles and national security considerations.”

In conclusion, the court's ruling is likely to prompt further discussions about legal processes in cases involving terrorism and their implications for justice and security.

item.title: 'Serious Breach Of Oath, Insults Constitution': Kerala CM On Nitesh Rane's 'Mini-Pakistan' Remarks - News18
item.description:
Kerala CM Criticizes Nitesh Rane's 'Mini-Pakistan' Remarks

Date: December 31, 2024
Source: News18

Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan condemned Maharashtra BJP Minister Nitesh Rane’s remarks calling Kerala a 'mini-Pakistan', describing it as a serious breach of oath and an insult to the Constitution.

  • Vijayan labeled Rane's comments as highly provocative and reflective of the Sangh Parivar's overall approach towards Kerala.
  • Opposition leaders called for Rane’s resignation, deeming his statements as hate speech that fosters division.
  • Rane's remarks sparked significant backlash from opposition parties and national discourse regarding their implications.
“The minister who made the hateful statement does not deserve to continue in that position,” - CM Pinarayi Vijayan

The incident highlights ongoing political tensions in India, reflecting broader issues of identity and communal relations.

item.title: Bigg Boss 18: Kangana Ranaut calls out Avinash Mishra for his ‘overacting; says, “Natural raho, ussi ke p - The Times of India
item.description:
Kangana Ranaut Critiques Avinash Mishra's Acting on Bigg Boss 18

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

The latest episode of Bigg Boss 18 featured actress Kangana Ranaut, who humorously advised contestant Avinash Mishra to tone down his dramatic acting style.

  • Kangana made a special appearance, offering advice and engaging with contestants.
  • She advised Avinash, saying, “Overacting nahi karna hai, natural, ussi ke paise milte hai” (Don’t overact, be natural; that’s what gets you paid).
  • The episode included a task where contestants had to give doses and treatments.
  • Kangana's entry generated excitement and brought a lighter mood to the show.
  • Avinash remains popular among fans for his entertaining antics, which sometimes spark debate.
Kangana's feedback highlighted the balance between entertainment and natural performance expected from contestants.

As Bigg Boss 18 unfolds, the interactions with prominent guests like Kangana continue to enhance the show's entertainment value.

item.title: OpenAI Whistleblower Suchir Balaji’s Mother Speaks Out: ‘Elon Musk Believes It’s A Murder’ - News18
item.description:
Mother of OpenAI Whistleblower Claims Elon Musk Suspects Murder

Date: December 31, 2024

Source: CNN-News18

Suchir Balaji's mother, Poornima Rao, asserts that police did not properly investigate her son's death, which has been labeled a suicide by authorities. She believes that Elon Musk suspects foul play surrounding the incident.

  • Suchir Balaji was a 26-year-old researcher at OpenAI.
  • He was discovered dead in his apartment in San Francisco.
  • Despite police findings of no foul play, the family hired a private investigator to challenge the ruling of suicide.
  • Poornima reports disturbing signs at the scene, including a ransacked desktop and blood spots.
  • No suicide note was found, and the family has not been permitted to see the body.
  • Musk questioned the official conclusion, stating it did not seem like a suicide.
“This doesn’t seem like a suicide.” - Elon Musk

The incident has garnered significant attention, with calls for intervention from U.S. authorities and skepticism about the circumstances surrounding Balaji's death.

item.title: Most anticipated movies of 2025: Captain America: Brave New World, Superman, Jurassic World Rebirth and more - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Most Anticipated Movies of 2025: Captain America: Brave New World, Superman, Jurassic World Rebirth and More

Date: Jan 01, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

This article highlights some of the most anticipated films set to release in 2025, spanning various genres and featuring both new and returning characters.

  • Captain America: Brave New World - Releases on February 14, featuring Sam Wilson as Captain America.
  • Snow White - Scheduled for March 21, starring Rachel Zegler and directed by Marc Webb.
  • Thunderbolts - Set for May 2, a Marvel film that focuses on an all-villain team.
  • Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning - Tom Cruise returns in this May 23 release.
  • Jurassic World Rebirth - Releasing on July 2, set five years after Jurassic World Dominion.
  • Superman - David Corenswet stars in this July 11 release directed by James Gunn.
“Superman embarks on a journey to reconcile his Kryptonian heritage with his human upbringing as Clark Kent.”

These films promise to deliver exciting stories and experiences for moviegoers in 2025.

item.title: Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations LIVE Updates: India rings in 2025 with joyful celebrations across the nation - The Indian Express
item.description:
Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations LIVE Updates

Date: January 1, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

As the hour strikes midnight, India celebrates the arrival of 2025 with unparalleled enthusiasm and fervor. With vibrant celebrations at every corner, this marks the start of a new year full of hopes, dreams, and possibilities.

  • Major cities across the globe, from Sydney to London, will illuminate the welcome with firework shows.
  • New York is hosting its famous Ball Drop featuring performances from various artists including Kesha, T-Pain, and The Jonas Brothers.
  • In India, police are taking measures for safety, including diversions around Connaught Place and bans on firecrackers in Chennai.
“The atmosphere is one of joy and anticipation.”

This New Year’s celebration reflects not only the joy of the moment but also a hopeful vision for 2025.

item.title: Santosh Trophy 2024-25: West Bengal beats Kerala 1-0 to clinch record-extending 33rd title - Sportstar
item.description:
West Bengal Clinches 33rd Santosh Trophy Title with 1-0 Win Over Kerala

Publication Date: November 2023 Source: Sportstar

West Bengal has re-asserted its dominance in the Santosh Trophy, winning the national football championship for a record 33rd time with a narrow 1-0 victory over Kerala.

  • Robi Hansda scored the decisive goal in the 90+4th minute.
  • Hansda was awarded both the Player of the Match and Player of the Tournament awards.
  • The match was marked by cautious play from both teams, with minimal scoring opportunities.
  • Bengal's key striker, Naro Hari Shrestha, was absent due to injury.
“In Bengal, it is all about winning the Santosh Trophy. To finish runners-up would be considered a failure.” - Sanjoy Sen, Coach of West Bengal

The victory reinforces West Bengal's football legacy and highlights the talent of young players under pressure.

item.title: World Blitz Championship 2024 LIVE Updates, Knockouts: Vaishali lone Indian in fray; Magnus vs Niemann in quarterfinal - Sportstar
item.description:
World Blitz Championship 2024 LIVE Updates, Knockouts: Vaishali beats Jiner to reach semis; Niemann loses to Carlsen in quarters

Date: January 01, 2025

Source: Sportstar

On January 1, 2025, R. Vaishali advanced to the semifinals of the World Blitz Championship 2024 after defeating Zhu Jiner, while Magnus Carlsen eliminated Hans Niemann in the quarterfinals.

  • Vaishali defeated Jiner to secure her place in the semifinals against Ju Wenjun.
  • Magnus Carlsen overcame Hans Niemann, securing his spot in the semifinals.
  • Vaishali had previously shown strong play, qualifying with an impressive score of 9.5/11.
  • Controversies arose during the tournament, particularly surrounding cheating allegations associated with Niemann.
"New controversy, new drama: Welcome to 2025"

The knockout phase of the championship shows intense competition among elite chess players, with high stakes leading to thrilling matches.

item.title: Heartbreaking Last Photo Of Boy, 3, Youngest Victim Killed In South Korea Plane Crash - News18
item.description:
Heartbreaking Last Photo Of Boy, 3, Youngest Victim Killed In South Korea Plane Crash

Date: December 31, 2024 Source: News18

A devastating final photo emerged of the three-year-old boy who was killed in the South Korean plane crash alongside his parents. Kang Ko, his wife Jin Lee Seon, and their son were tragically lost in the Jeju Air Boeing 737-800 crash while attempting an emergency landing at Muan International Airport.

  • The plane crash claimed 179 lives on December 31, 2024.
  • The boy was on his first trip abroad for Christmas.
  • Kang Ko worked in public relations for the Kia Tigers baseball team.
  • Two flight attendants were the only survivors among the 181 people onboard.
  • Authorities are investigating the crash.
“He was so good at his job that everyone on our company’s baseball broadcasting team liked him.” - Jung Woo-young

This tragic event highlights the fragility of life and the deep impact such incidents have on families and communities.

item.title: Live Updates | Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations: Countdown To Midnight Begins; India Set To Welcome - Zee News
item.description:
Happy New Year 2025 Live Updates

Publication Date: December 31, 2024
Source: Zee News

As 2024 draws to a close, we stand on the cusp of a brand-new year, ready to welcome 2025 with open arms, symbolizing fresh opportunities and new beginnings.

  • New Year's Day falls on January 1, 2025, which is a Wednesday.
  • The celebrations feature dazzling fireworks and public gatherings in cities around the world.
  • Famous events include the Ball Drop in New York with performances from popular artists.
  • Global cities illuminate the skies with firework displays.
“This transition brings a sense of hope and renewal.”

The arrival of 2025 is marked by celebrations across India and worldwide, gathering people to reflect on the past year and set aspirations for the future.

item.title: US News Today highlights on December 31, 2024 : Sunita Williams to celebrate New Year 2025 16 times in space | Today News - Mint
item.description:
Sunita Williams to Celebrate New Year 2025 16 Times in Space

Date: 31 Dec 2024 | Source: LiveMint

Astronaut Sunita Williams and the Expedition 72 crew will uniquely celebrate New Year’s by witnessing 16 sunrises and sunsets in just 24 hours while aboard the International Space Station (ISS).

  • Astronaut Sunita Williams and her crew are prepared to celebrate New Year’s Eve in a distinctive manner from space.
  • The ISS crew will see 16 different sunrises and sunsets during the 24-hour period of New Year's Eve and New Year's Day.
“Witnessing New Year 2025 from orbit is a truly unique experience!” - Sunita Williams

This celebration marks a remarkable event in space exploration and draws attention to human achievements in science and technology.

item.title: Yemen death sentence for Kerala woman: India adopting a cautious route in conflict-hit Sanaa - The Hindu
item.description:
India Treads Cautiously on Yemen Death Sentence of Kerala Woman

Published on: December 31, 2024, Source: The Hindu

India is cautiously addressing the sensitive case of Nimisha Priya, a Kerala woman sentenced to death in Yemen for the murder of her Yemeni business partner, amid the complexities of operating in regions controlled by the Houthi faction.

  • Nimisha Priya has been sentenced to death after being convicted of killing her business partner in Yemen.
  • The Yemeni conflict involves multiple factions, complicating the legal and diplomatic situation.
  • India does not have official communication with the Houthis, raising challenges for intervention.
  • Negotiations may be underway for a possible settlement based on Yemeni customs of blood money.
“The government is extending all possible help in the matter,” said Mr. Jaiswal.

This case highlights the intricate intersection of legal processes, international relations, and local conflict in Yemen.

item.title: Puerto Rico’s power grid collapses, leaving island in the dark - DAWN.com
item.description:
Puerto Rico Faces Widespread Power Outage on New Year’s Eve

Publication Date: New Year’s Eve

Source: LUMA Energy

Puerto Ricans were left without electricity early on New Year’s Eve due to a grid failure affecting nearly the entire island.

  • Approximately 90% of clients lost power on Tuesday morning at 9:30 AM (6:30 PST).
  • Restoration of power is expected to take 24 to 48 hours, pending conditions.
  • The cause of the outage is under investigation, with preliminary findings suggesting a failure in an underground line.
  • Governor Pedro Pierluisi has called for accountability from energy providers.
  • Puerto Rico has a history of frequent power outages, exacerbated by past infrastructure issues and Hurricane Maria.
“This is a major incident,” said Ivan Baez, spokesperson for power generator Genera.

Residents are urged to stay informed as efforts continue to restore power across the island.
